frame.name: Body_movement
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words for motions or actions an <fen>Agent</fen> performs using some part of his/her body.
A number of words in this frame occur as blends with Communication, in which the action has an <fen>Addressee</fen>. For example,
<ex>Pat <t>nodded</t> <fex name="Addressee">at Kim</fex>.</ex>
These examples differ from Communication.Gesture in that no specific message need be expressed, as in <ex>She <t>nodded</t> to him to sit down.</ex>
Since this frame involves a particular type of motion, it contains the frame elements <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, <fen>Goal</fen> and <fen>Area</fen>, which originate in the motion frame. All of these frame elements are generally expressed in PP Complements. <ex>The boy <t>swung</t> his legs <fex name="Source">from under the table</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> uses some part of his/her body to perform the action. <fen>Agent</fen> occurs as the External Argument. <ex><fex name="Agent">The boy</fex> <t>swung</t> his legs.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>With some verbs in this frame, the <fen>Body_part</fen> involved in the action is specified by the meaning of the verb and cannot be expressed separately. For example, <ex>Pat <t>yawned</t> (*his mouth).</ex> With others, the <fen>Body_part</fen> is specified by the verb but can optionally be expressed separately, although its presence is generally redundant, as in <ex>Pat <t>nodded</t> <fex name="BodP">(his head)</fex>.</ex> A few verbs have a default <fen>Body_part</fen> which need not be expressed, but can be overridden by the expression of some other <fen>Body_part</fen>. <ex>Pat <t>waved</t> <fex name="BodP">(his arms)</fex>.</ex> (The objectless version of the sentence, <ment>Pat waved</ment>, is a blend with communication.) The remainder of the verbs require a <fen>Body_part</fen> to be expressed in a separate constituent: <ex>Pat <t>rolled</t> <fex name="BodP">his eyes</fex>.</ex> <fen>Body_part</fen> generally occurs as the direct object. </def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>Body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, the <fen>Agent</fen>'s mental or emotional state. <fen>Internal_cause</fen> is expressed in a PP Complement. <ex>Kim <t>bent</t> her head <fex name="ICause">in concentration</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>threw</t> her hands up <fex name="ICause">in despair</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: External_cause
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Cause</fen> is something in the external environment that causes the <fen>Agent</fen> to move part of his/her body. <fen>Cause</fen> is usually expressed in a PP Complement:. <ex>Pat <t>jerked</t> her head <fex name="Cause">at the sudden noise</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kim's nose <t>wrinkled</t> <fex name="Cause">at the smell</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <fen>Cause</fen> does not include any physical force moving the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Body_part</fen>. This type of situation is described by the frame Motion.Cause-to-move. </def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Addressee</fen> only occurs in the Body-movement frame in sentences which are blends with Communication. Where it occurs, it is typically a PP Complement: <ex>Pat <t>fluttered</t> his eyelashes <fex name="Add">at me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Source</fen> is the place from which the <fen>Body_part</fen> is moved. <ex>The boy <t>swung</t> his legs <fex name="Source">from under the table</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> identifies the trajectory of motion of the <fen>Body_part</fen> without specifying a start or end point. <ex>Pat <t>flung</t> his arms <fex name="Path">up</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that identifies the endpoint of movement.
<ex>Pat <t>dropped</t> her hands <fex name="Goal">to her lap</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Area</fen> identifies any expression describing a region in which the motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. (This FE should be contrasted with <fen>Place</fen>.)
<ex>Pat <t>waved</t> her arms <fex name="Area">about her head</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor of an action. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the body movement occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an event.</def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Message</fen> that the body movement conveys.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the body movement occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE specifies the subregion of the body that is involved with movement. <ex><fex name="Agent">He</fex> <t>bent</t> <fex name="Body_part">his legs</fex> <fex name="Sub-region">at his knees</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose of the body movement. <ex>He winked his eye <fex name="Purpose">to give her a hint</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognate_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the event noun of the verb. <ex>He <t>clapped</t> <fex name="Cognate_event">his loudest clap</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period of time during which the movement of a <fen>Body_part</fen> occurs.
<ex>It seemed like we were clapping our hands <fex name="dur">for hours</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location within which the movement of a <fen>Body_part</fen> takes place.
<ex>There was singing for joy in the streets, and <fex name="pla">everywhere</fex> people lifting their arms into the air. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition:
<def-root>An alternative description of the Body_movement.
<ex><fex name="Re-encoding">In a bid to reenter the conversation</fex> , he kept <t>waving</t> his hand towards the rest of them.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Coordinated_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event that the <fen>Agent</fen> perceives and responds to by moving in coordination with it.
<ex>They <t>bobbed</t> their heads <fex name="coo">to the beat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: arch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To from or cause a curved structure.

lexUnit.name: bat.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flutter (one's eyelashes).

lexUnit.name: bend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move a body part (usu the head or the extremities) so it forms a curve or angle with the body part it is attached to

lexUnit.name: blink.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shut and open the eyes quickly.

lexUnit.name: bob.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or cause to make a quick, short movement up and down.

lexUnit.name: clap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: strike the palms of (one's hands) together repeatedly

lexUnit.name: cock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bend a (limb or joint) at an angle.

lexUnit.name: crane.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stretch out (one's neck) in order to see something.

lexUnit.name: cross.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to place a pair of extremities across each other

lexUnit.name: drop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move lower, to cause to sink

lexUnit.name: flap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (for a body part) to move or be moved up and down or from side to side

lexUnit.name: flex.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: contract a muscle (often in order to bend a joint)

lexUnit.name: fling.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: throw forcefully; hurl.

lexUnit.name: flutter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (usu for a straight, long body part) to move with a light irregular motion

lexUnit.name: gnash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grind (one's teeth) together, especially as a sign of anger.

lexUnit.name: grind.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rub together gratingly.

lexUnit.name: hang.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to allow (one's head) to fall, droop

lexUnit.name: jerk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move quickly, sharply, suddenly

lexUnit.name: lift.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: raise to a higher position or level

lexUnit.name: nod.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to allow (one's head) to fall, droop

lexUnit.name: pout.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to sulk

lexUnit.name: pucker.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tightly gather or contract into wrinkles or small folds.

lexUnit.name: purse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to the lips) pucker or contract.

lexUnit.name: roll.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move a body part on an axis, rotate

lexUnit.name: shake.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move forcefully or quickly up and down or to and fro.

lexUnit.name: shrug.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: raise (one's shoulders) slightly and momentarily to express doubt, ignorance, or indifference.

lexUnit.name: shuffle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: restlessly shift one's position.

lexUnit.name: stretch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: straighten or extend one's body or a part of one's body to its full length.

lexUnit.name: swing.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move or cause to move back and forth or from side to side

lexUnit.name: throw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move quickly, hurriedly, or roughly

lexUnit.name: toss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: jerk (one's head or hair) sharply backwards

lexUnit.name: twitch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or cause to make a short, sudden jerking movement.

lexUnit.name: wag.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (especially with reference to an animal's tail) move rapidly to and fro.

lexUnit.name: waggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move with short quick movements from side to side or up and down.

lexUnit.name: wave.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move (one's hand or arm, or something held in one's hand) to and fro.

lexUnit.name: wiggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or cause to move with short movements up and down or from side to side.

lexUnit.name: wink.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: close and open one eye quickly, typically as a signal of affection or greeting or to convey a message.

lexUnit.name: wrinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become wrinkled.

lexUnit.name: curtsy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's or girl's formal greeting made by bending the knees with one foot in front of the other.

lexUnit.name: kneel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or rest on a knee or the knees.

lexUnit.name: writhe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: twist or squirm in pain or as if in pain

lexUnit.name: wriggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: twist and turn with quick writhing movements

lexUnit.name: shudder.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tremble or shake convulsively, especially as a result of fear or repugnance.

lexUnit.name: fidget.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make small movements through nervousness or impatience.

lexUnit.name: yawn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: involuntarily open one's mouth wide and inhale deeply due to tiredness or boredom.

lexUnit.name: jiggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move lightly and quickly from side to side or up and down. "The car jiggled on its springs."

lexUnit.name: shiver.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shake slightly and uncontrollably as a result of being cold, frightened, or excited.

lexUnit.name: curtsy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform a curtsy

lexUnit.name: duck.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: lower the head or body quickly to avoid a blow or missile or so as not to be seen.

lexUnit.name: crease.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a crease in the skin, especially the face

lexUnit.name: smack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: part (one's lips) noisily

lexUnit.name: open.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move (a bodypart) so that it is open.

lexUnit.name: close.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move (a bodypart) so that it is closed.

lexUnit.name: shut.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move (a bodypart) such that it is closed.

lexUnit.name: twiddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move (one's thumbs), generally as a humorously pointless way to spend time.

lexUnit.name: stamp.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or an object, perhaps crushing, or flattening it.

lexUnit.name: crinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form or cause to form small creases or wrinkles.

lexUnit.name: crumple.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: crease or wrinkle

lexUnit.name: scrunch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: squeeze together

lexUnit.name: move.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change the position/location of a body part

lexUnit.name: twist.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move part of one's body around; writhe, wriggle.

lexUnit.name: wink.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of closing one eye and quickly reopening it

lexUnit.name: reach.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To actively extend a body part in a direction (not necessarily specified)
